comments.body: rejected suggestion

Idk about this idea. I would like to see them in the game, but maybe we can't place them in lava. Mojang already answered lava boats. Maybe they would work on water though. Also, they would be an upgrade to boats in the smithing table and it would make them immune to magma blocks and possibly make them go faster. I honestly would just like to see them in-game for the colors.

I think the purpose of the Strider was to come up with a unique way to cross the lava lakes in the Nether. These boats that you describe would make Striders useless. I think the devs purposefully avoided making these boats because this idea is unoriginal and that is not fun. Besides, making these boats would be too easy; lava is supposed to be a challenge to cross not a minor inconvenience.

It would probably break balance to just have these boats work on lava of they were made the same as other boats, but perhaps they could require a Netherite shovel to craft? Making them harder to obtain might balance that out. I do want to see these boats just for the color variety, though, whether they work on lava or not
I would like to see these simply for consistency, but I do think there needs to be a reason why you would use them over Striders, and vice versa
Perhaps they can't move in lava, but they still don't burn. They could then be attached to Striders who could use them to pull mobs and chests across lava

I'd be interested to see a siren archer type creature that lures you in with mind control magic. It could also be a poison a jungle creature has or it could be like that fungus that takes over ants bodies and turns them into zombie ants. I like the idea.

Mayne instead of full possession it instead causes the player character to move uncontrollably (running, jumping, dropping items etc.) For the duration. And mayne a new mob to inflict it? Like a siren or maybe a new bat type that is larger/more aggressive with a slight life steal effect
We should be able to take the either
Way to op
Neat concept but it sounds very overpowered in practical applications. You could possess a creeper and detonate all the other mobs around or possess a player and make them jump off a cliff.

Yes I like this but you should be able to add a portal in game using certain new blocks like a portal charger and an entry and exit point marker also there should be an arrow of paralysation where if you get hit you cannot move for 10 seconds 40 based on the strength and if you shoot a player they gain a poison effect for 5 seconds like there body is deteriorating pls add these also xbox hasnt got the nether update please work on this thank you.
Be great to posses the ................ Zombies,and Ender Dragons they totally need to add it.
I like this idea but there would have to be like a 30 second cool down also you can only control something for like 8 seconds

This would probably be even more of a crutch than poison arrows. In addition, it would be near impossible to control the enemy character that you hit with the arrow. If it was to use WASD, that would leave you vulnerable to attacks from other players. We don't need to make combat any easier than it already is. We have swords and bows. Learn to use them.

No, it doesn't fit with Minecraft.

I don't understand why such ideas gets so much votes!

this seems very good so I think a fair crafting recipe should be as follows: arrow + enchanted Apple + eye of ender *2 + diamond*2+ glowstone. Also, you can add a maximum of 3 glowstone to increase the duration.
The recipe would like this on a table:
EoE Ea EoE
D A D
G G G
where EoE is ender eye Ea is enchanted Apple d is diamond a is arrow g is glowstone. The maximum duration should be 20 seconds
Not only that, but strays should be immune too. And maybe should be able to walk on powdered snow.
This would be amazing for adventure maps.
I just thought of this, the enchantments given would be an enchantment made for that particular tool; you wouldn't want protection on a sword!
You could right-click an enchantment table with a bottle to get one
I didn't know that, Thank you, @FishyWishyEF
you can get them from trading though
Though how do you wear it? Do you hold it?

You hold it in your inventory, you can also teach it when dropped or when in a chest or shulker, it can also be attached and detached to mobs. The point is you can track mobs or hold it in your inventory to track the place where you died
I love decorating with snow so, good idea.
Igloos should be remade to be made out of snow bricks, like in real life. They could also have campfires in them
This idea sounds good, but i gotta say @cranzag's idea of snow bricks sounds even better üíôüíôüíô
Hoppers can‚Äôt transfer the items up but conveyor belts will be able to. conveyor belts are a great idea!!
Conveyer belts are great and one thing they could do that hoppers can't is actually Move entities around for like mob farms and such
If rope bridges sway, then ladders may have to be the same

Then you could use the way to prevent to copper from aging on cobble to prevent it too (w/e the method is they never gave details but it's confirmed, hopefully it's beeswax)

Tbh I feel like iron should also age like copper near/in water too, esp. since the ore block looks rusted anyways. And moss should also spread to logs too (that's where moss grows most IRL, idk why there isn't in MC) but now I'm just rambling.
Im only voting for this for lingering potions to be moved to honey. I‚Äôm waiting on your amazing elixir idea.
Yes, I just tweeted about this earlier today, I am glad someone said this already...Now can we make this happen??

I think that a new ore (like copper or something) can make a telescope. Maybe iron could make it to? However I think you should create a new ore (like copper) that you can find in caves. Then if you have glass and copper you put them in a crafting table and BAM you got a telescope.

405365347471

A lot of what you described is coming to Minecraft in the 1.17 update in summer 2021. They are adding copper, which can be crafted with the new amethyst geodes to craft a telescope. For more information about the 1.17 update, type Minecraft Live 2020 into the youtube search bar.
Possibly a new name for it; Curse of Reject (Hence, it rejects new enchantments)
Maybe the recipe could be a goat horn and a candle
I agree. This would be great to the 1.19 or 1.20 updates
üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº
Yes!  I love this idea!!  Maybe we could have yellow-orange colored crystals under Desert biomes...  And lime colored crystals under Jungle biomes...

More foods Like corn, tomato, green beans, rice, strawberries, blueberries, pears, bananas, lettuce, onions and dairy products like cheese. Since we already have milk, and craftable food combos like sandwiches and cake I think we could expand these to more food combinations. I think a crop (food) and mob update would really benefit the minecraft gameplay options.
The function of curing zombie villagers already serves that purpose but having visitors come to pre-existing villages would be interesting
Great concept
I like this! It's a bit OP, but I think that would be ok, because it could be made very rare and/or very dangerous to obtain.
I agree with this except maybe you could make a similar version out of wool that just silenced sounds and offered very little protection. A cheap version if you will
Feather falling could have a similar effect! Producing less vibrations as it makes the player much lighter on their feet :)
Ice slabs could generate in the terrain to crack underfoot.

I saw another post suggesting bunny slippers, that utilized rabbit's feet in their recipe. I think that might be the perfect about of expensiveness to make it balanced!
Not to mention you're replacing an armour slot.
Great idea I hope this gets added.

I think they should be found in the deep dark caves, as it would balance the wool shoes and would introduece people to the warden before being able to find these shoes, as people would go in the caves and find the warden before the shoes, leaving that experience and what to expect.

I think it might be better for amethyst to be used to craft a block that looks very similar to the geode that doesn't grow more crystals. This way it means you have more of a reason to farm amethyst, plus having two blocks with the same texture that do different things could be somewhat confusing
how about a compass that lets you find amethyst geodes......made like a regular compass but has amethyst crystal in it instead of redstone.....will point to the nearest mass of amethyst....
This is a good idea! However, I think we could use leather armor as an existing way to make it harder to hear, especially the boots from walking.

This is a great idea! The player can decide whether to forgo the protection of better armor for more stealth. I think wool clothing should barely shield you from damage, and would hurt you more if you were in lava or fire.
I love the idea but it should use leather because leather armor already exists in minecraft but I love this idea
I love this idea too.But my little sister really want this idea too because she watches Aphmau and want it to come true
